They are from trolls. Look at their hating history. I'm not going to bother to try and sell you on this movie. Watch it for fun and screw the haters. I'm babbling to fill the minimum sentences. I watch for fun and don't need realism. Sometimes I give a negative review because something is too far fetched but, this isn't that. Give it a try if you have the time. This might not be as good as the original but, it's not worse in my opinion. Take a chance and I think you won't be disappointed.
Couldn't have picked a better Genius. A Dave's great performance

When I went in the theatres with my friend I was excited I guess but it was a complete bore...none of the tricks made sense which added in so many plot wholes the acting was horrible and the cops basically just guessed where they were and there plan...and the ending even gets more confusing because the bad gay was a good guy all along and the guy they hacked was then on there side so why did they just do it then a there if they were good why did they need to go threw all of that because that film could of been 15 minutes long but it was more than an hour and a half because "magic" I guess I only give it 3 stars for the visuals.

The irony lies in the fact a lot of 'reviewers' have the audacity to say other 'reviewers' are wrong. I studied film at university, so i know what i'm talking about. I thought it was entertaining (granted plot holes) but who cares, i just wanted a popcorn action/thriller/comedy to enjoy. And guess what? i did. Get off your high horses as you have no idea as to what you are talking about, it was about pace and juxtaposition between characters, elements that are vital in film. A beginning, middle and an end (if you follow those rules) Ivory towers indeed.

Review title: Exciting But Majorly Flawed and Utterly Ridiculous!
Review_body: If David Blaine, David Copperfield and Michael Bay made a film, it would be this.The first film was cool: lots of flashy slight-of-hand, misdirection and stage magic that were slightly plausible in an "Oceans 11" kind of way. This poorly-written sequel is so full of holes and over-the-top illusions it borders on science fiction. The extra backstories just muddy the waters and the unnecessary addition of extra A-listers doesn't add to the story.This films ties up some loose ends that you didn't realize existed from the first film and attempts to leave room for future films.

Review title: Nice film with great magical performances
Review_body: Among the other movies in the theaters this week, this is a good choice to spend your two hours.. I think the age warning of above 13 for this movie is actually right. My advice is that if you're above 40, it may not entertain you because this film doesn't include much logic among some events that follow one another. Another thing is that this is also a movie about a struggle of saving the world from the bad guys. There many movies like that but this movie saves itself from being boring with the humor & sarcasm of the characters. Magics which we cannot come across in real life help a lot to take the movie to a higher position in the audience's point of view.Best parts of the film: 1. The voyage of the horsemen after they jump through the tunnel. 2. When four of the horsemen are together in a room where they are being searched for a possible theft.3. The magical performances of the horsemen in a city center at a special day of the year.4. The audience may not guess how the film will end, will the horsemen succeed or not?5. There may be a 3rd film of this series.

The entire movie was messy and exhausting - scenes that should be 10 seconds long, instead took 10minutes. The movie itself makes no sense- it's very poorly written. The dialogues was dry and cringy. The magic tricks felt pointless(unnecessary) and no wow factors.They built up for a plot but it was absolutely terrible...They had many great actors and therefor this movie will probably make it's money back but the movie itself was horrendously bad (I don't understand how it can have score of 7 so far)Lizzy Caplan acting was horrible or they just wanted her role to look like trash...1/10.

Review title: And Now You See A Pile of Poop
Review_body: I'm baffled that this film received more than four stars. I got about 20 minutes into the first one and bailed. Stinky #2 got on my nerves from the opening scene, then I dozed off, then I woke up when there was some loud street fight. I watched about ten more minutes and said "fk this". Am I the only one annoyed by the 'no biggie' attitudes of the main characters? I never felt like they were truly in danger. It's just one boring, chaotic dress rehearsal. I picture a twelve year old sitting in the director's chair. This film, and the one before it, are Romper Room mayhem and there's nothing appealing about the script or the acting. Very disappointing. I shouldn't have been foolish enough to think the sequel would be any better, so I take responsibility for being suckered twice. At least I didn't spend a penny to see either one. I still wasted my time, other than when I dozed off. It's crap, don't bother with this movie.

If the first one was a little over mediocrity, this one is very bad. The writing is very bad, with a lot of plot holes and nonsense things. It was clicked, dumb and an unnecessary sequel. The acting was unimpressive and Daniel Radcliffe was horrible.

Review title: The third one MUST be called "Now You Don't"
Review_body: I felt like this second installment was stretched to a comedy, but still has what made the first movie great. Whatever that is. I love it.

Review title: This was better than the first one though!
Review_body: The fact that this is rated lesser than the first one is crazy.Okay, not really. I'm just weird, I guess.But I am not afraid to say that I liked this one way more than the first. It brought out way more reactions out of me than Now You See Me. I love both the movies so so much. Maybe my favourite movie of all time? I don't know.

Soo Magic! I'm writing this on a fire tablet. Bare with me, not liking it. This movie ain't great but is cool. What's the difference between great and cool? Its how much you smile. Its fun , its enduring (meaning a 3rd is inevitable.) But the p!ot lacks attention. The relationship between me and anyone from this movie is not true.What happen since the last time we encountered these guys? In the first movie, the relationship between hulk and his father, was great, here I don't know why he is still in the FBI. Take the flash but essence is gone. Pretty is dope, though.Pretty don't always pay out. P.S. Franco pulled some great card tricks,I read he really practiced. Woody did not manipulate the thoughts of anyone in this film, but in his defense he has been trying to do this for years!

Almost every single incident that occurs throughout this entire movie, every line, every bump, every movement, is a coincidental plot device used to assist one of the main characters in escaping some sort of predicament or overcoming some obstacle which they may encounter. This occurs so often and (might I add) with the subtlety of a giant neon sign with flickering lights displaying the words- "PLEASE NOTICE THIS ITS IMPORTANT BUT WE WONT TELL YOU WHY"-It's almost insulting to the viewers intelligence. This is a movie about the subtle art of slight of hand and illusion its supposed to be mysterious, at least attempt to be subtle in your "coincidental plot devices" I know this is a fictional story and in such cases we can be liberal with reality, fine i accept that; however if you are going to give not one but three of the characters the ability to instantly hypnotize people, making them do basically whatever the hell you damn well please, the rest of the show, the fancy lights the trickery all that just seems pointless. Oh but there is a catch people can only be hypnotized when they are off guard. Fine wait for mr baddie to be off guard do your vodoo magic on his mind and make him give his money back to the poor or whatever it is you require. What are the rest of the horsemen needed for. I can go on and on and on and on but you get the point. Don't try to be a "who dunnit" type mystery when you can make anyone do what you want when you want that's goes be on lazy writing.

Now You See Me 2 Loved the first one, had to see the second one. It had all the good characters in, Lex Luthor, the Hulk, Haymitch Abernathy, Alfred, God and even Harry Potter.The movie had a good plot and it was a really fun movie to watch, the acting was good. I mean this is totally Jesse Eisenberg movie, rather than the other one he completely Butchered. *Cough* BVS.The effects were good and it did a good job at keeping me entertained. The Villain of this movie however was not so good. The acting was alright, but it did nothing to make me feel like he's a legitimate threat. Also the plot twist were a bit predictable, you kinda knew that the 4 Horsemen would be ahead of the villain for the most part.All in all though, it was a pretty good movie.8/10

Review title: Another Hollywood attempt to paint people as racist/sexist/etc.
Review_body: From the get go, they do nothing but tear down all the male characters in this movie ... turning them into the inept ego, the mousy talent, and the buffoon, all for the glory of a new female character... I couldn't get past the new girl character having to prove she was better than all the guy characters... it was obnoxious... the writers even put in several lines making all the old characters you came to like as sexist pigs... of course corrected by the female character... Who writes this s*!t.... and it is offal. They ruin a good thing making it a big lesson against aggravated sexism that you don't really see half as much in today's society as you do on the big screen... Again only in the movies and on TV are you being sold that your a terrible person... boo....
Deep within reality lie you. Not the otherwise of it.
I ignored the bad reviews, went along for the ride and had a good time!
Only for kids , no plot, no scenario, unconnected characters.

Review title: You know a movie is bad when...
Review_body: ***SPOILER ALERT***...a movie about magicians tries to have you believe that a trick where they have the horsemen end up in China after falling through a tube is the result of them getting drugged and transported via private jet.Logistics FAIL - Somehow, after getting to China on the private jet, they were thrown into a tube just like the one they started going down in and waking up falling through said tube having no idea that they were out for more than a minute (transport drugged horsemen to airport, trip to China, trip from Chinese airport to a building with similarly setup tube, etc).That was when I considered switching this nonsense off. I endured but it was a total waste of time.The first movie was much more believable despite it having its own flaws. This is a B-rated movie story line with an A-class cast (Isla Fisher was a better female cast) but the story was so bad there was no saving grace for this one.
What a big let down.. Tut. The first one was really good ,then they milked it with number 2 which isn't going any where..

What is this? bad story, no twist,bad ilusion and magic. Who wrote this trash.Henley just gone like that,and come lula. What for? what exactly her role? just flying the pigeon?
how about jay chou? standing,be there and be cool .
The Horsemen here all just fool, not like 1st movie they are full of skill,proud of them self and doing just fine alone,here, they are just a little tief that got played by everyone and tossed here and there.
Atlas has no brain, Jack best show was his hypnose? , Merrit clumsy and no strength.
The card trick,when they stealing the chip is way too long ,bad trick and unrealistic,not funny,no excitment, who would get tricked like that?
This movie has no momentum, no character. All is absurd.
Not a very good storyline, was quite cliche and not that much magic scenes. Bunch of good actors, but poor storyline

Burdened with exposition and backstory, NYSM2 really doesn't understand its characters. 1's Radical free agents are now second rung govt. flunkies with no free will of their own, waiting by the phone to take orders. Like Bond in Skyfall.It's pure treason. 1's heroes who wanted to disappear, who hack, and steal with robinhood charm become 2's lackeys, chasing down "evil" people who want to disappear, to hack, steal, like Bond movies, have more charm than the heroes.If you watch 2 in isolation without seeing 1, you might watch an entertaining film of magic tricks, even if it is kind of Ice Age minus Scrat.If you've seen 1, and rewatching it doesn't work for you, try 2, but keep the remote handy. You might need to fast forward.The 5 stars are for cgi-enhanced magic tricks, even when story pointless, and it was fun to watch even if incredibly painful at times.

What should be expected from this movie? I believe that is the most important question before watching these kind of movies. It obviously will not take you and challenge your brain to understand what is happening. The plot is much simpler in a comparison with the prequel. When the plot is much simpler, that also means this movie will not appeal to the group of people it supposed to appeal. You know what that means? Drumroll please... It means you will lose $30.000.000. I mean, what were they trying to do? Were they trying to make people laugh? If that was it, why did not they just put Jesses Eisenberg in a room with that poor interviewer girl again. That way, they would not spend $90.000.000 for a dead project. Come on people. Hollywood may have done this just to keep the tradition of butchering decent movies by making terrible sequels. That would explain it. But, there is one good thing about the movie, the acting, at the beginning of the movie by the young Dylan, that was incredible, just incredible.
When i was watching this movie,i couldent stand on my seat.but i dont know why people didnt like it. it was great

How these Chinese producers can pay enough money for a great cast to risk their legacy and career is beyond me. Must have been one hell of a paycheck!Note to self: Don't EVER see a Chinese produced movie ever again!

Review title: Reasonable heist flick at the start. Totally falls apart at the end.
Review_body: Every time someone tries to shoehorn Morgan Freeman into one of these genre knockoffs (Ocean's 11 knockoff in this case; that 'Wanted' one he did with Angelina Jolie was some kind of Da Vinci Code-esque piece of cheese with The Loom of Destiny at the end), the whole thing just goes sideways.This was a perfectly serviceable stylish-if-not-believable heist movie until the last half-hour when the supposed 'reveals' introduce about a million plot holes and 'WTF?s' until you wish it'd just be over already, because it's killing whatever positive feelings you managed to have about it.If you're in the mood for a heist film, go watch Ocean's 11, 12, 13 or 8. Any of them are better than this, even the ones that critics said were disappointments.

Review title: Perfect , don't trust other comments that say different , here is why
Review_body: As a big fan of first movie I had a lot to expect from this one. Today while I was reading what other users say I found out that almost everyone who said it was bad , had put out the same negatives like the tricks are magic and not illusions. Well I just watched it and its perfect , there is so much more new info on the eye and the horseman , a lots of new tricks with expl at the end , and for people who still don't uderstand it , pls learn something about science and basic laws of nature . Cast and acting are perfect and so is story. Great movie and I cant waot to see the big finale in the third movie . Hope it comes out soon Seeing is believing

Review title: Even better than the first one
Review_body: I swear people just expect that it will be worse just because it's a sequel, but it's definitely not. It builds up on the first movie in every way and the excitement level is definitely higher.

This movie is a decent night out if you have nothing better to do. Great talented cast, but the writing was boring, predictable and corny. The plot was a bit interesting however it was bogged down in silliness and college level 101 writing. The love interest was never developed which was a good thing since it didn't belong in this mess, The background of a main character was interesting. The ending too fantastic and overdone to believe when they outlined everything they had planned to bring this plan to fruition............ Did they really need a twin brother in there? What a waste of talent this movie was for the award winning cast. Again, if you need 2 hours to kill or something on the TV to eat pizza with, then fine. Still better than a lot of the sequels that you see out there, I guess.

Review title: Great sequel! Don't assume based on the negative reviews - see it for yourself
Review_body: I don't understand all the hate for this movie. It accomplished the same ends as the first one, and even exceeded it in some ways. Just like the first, it started with a simple plot, added in some humor and dazzling magic tricks, and then brought in a twist at the end. Very fun movie, with complex characters. Sure, it's not a FANTASTIC movie. But I don't think it was meant to be an award- winner or anything. It celebrates the mystery and magic of illusion, and reminds viewers that even today, audiences can still be fooled, if the magician has just enough intuition (and money) to pull it off.I would've given 10 stars, but the romance was poorly executed, and some of the plot elements bothered me. Loved it though. Don't believe the negative reviews. Watch it for yourself and see what you think.

Review title: Spoiler Alert? How can you spoil Garbage?
Review_body: They got paid money to do this. I mean actual American currency to make this so called movie. Ya know, I really hate Hollywood anymore. But on the other hand, I've always Hated Hollywood. They're so predictable, and this pretentious crap makes the point all the more glaring. Go on, watch it. Sit there in awe as Hollywood actors & directors come together to boggle your mind with mediocrity. Fortunately, and thank Heavens for torrents, I did NOT pay once cent toward this enterprise. The only consolation I take, is that on Judgement Day, Hollywood will burn in the lake of fire, along with this nonsense. Cheers! Mark Oh great, and now the IMDb tells me upon review that I didn't reach the minimum of 10 lines of text. Well la-de-da. What kind of nonsense criteria is that anyway? Who wants to read on and on about absolutely nothing? What a bunch of retards at work.

"Now You See Me 2" is the sequel for the 2013 movie "Now You See Me", and features Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Dave Franco, Mark Ruffalo, and as a replacement for Isla Fisher, Lizzy Caplan. Like its predecessor, the movie follows the same behaviour pattern by showing the same amount of crazy, unexplainable magic tricks, so that we, the moviegoers, can feel impressed and amazed. Even though the movie tries to explain some of its many insane magic tricks, some tricks are still left unexplained which leaves me as viewer with an increased skepticism of the lack of realness showed in the movie. I know the movie is supposed to be fun, exciting and nothing more, but it would still have been nice to see some kind of explanation to some of the bigger tricks, that did not involve cards. For the acting part: Lizzy Caplan did a good job as the replacer for Isla Fisher, being both credible and funny. I loved that her humour felt real and not forced, and when I say "forced" I mean in a way where scriptwriters make her say one too many funny one-liners, but instead she would say what came to her mind and it worked great. Mark Ruffalo was great and had by far the most emotional story in the movie, which made him more interesting to follow than any of the other Four Horsemen. Daniel Radcliff as the main antagonist also worked great, and I really believed his portrayal of a crazy, sociopathic billionaire. The one performance in the movie that annoyed me was by someone who played a twin-brother to one of the horsemen, and this characters behaviour just got on my nerves throughout the movie. In the end, the movie is a good time with popcorn and soda, and instead of asking yourself, "how the f**k did they pull that trick of?" you should just try by going with the flow of the movie and it will give you 2 hours of fun and excitement.

Awesome as always. I can't imagine a movie like this in my life or in my dizziest daydreams. Just a perfect movie. Got inspired in a way no one can ever imagine. Why can't I get it out of my freakin' head. can imagine but me. Everything was excellent...everything. The story and tricks were OooO Myyyy Goooosssh, who would have thought of it, probably a genius minded person. Awesome AF. I'm surely looking forward towards the third part. Wonder what's it's gonna be like. Keep it up guys. And also the soundtrack was amazing as usual. I've bought it for the first one and so am I gonna do this time for the second one. But to sum it up...this will be the best movie you'll see in this year...for sure.

As director jon has carried the momentum of magic from previous installment with inclusion of Technology and action. Jesse was impeccable with his tricks. The action and acts were bigger and better then ts predecessors, and were only highlight of the movie. Music plays a lot in thriller and suspense movies so was in this too. The theme music is the same. It takes you to the next level of state of mind. I got watched this movie on flickstree.com which offers its user with an option to watch their choice of movies online sitting at home in a very good quality. It also offers its users a personalized suggestion option where everyone can check out movies according to their mood.

If you let yourself go with the flow of the movie you will notice you will enjoy yourself. Good acting, good effects, good timing, all beter then the first instalmentBut any form of critical analys, or even thinking during the movie will ruin the complete experience. The script is abysmal, some scenes dont make sense and often undermines it own setups.So just dont think.

Overall it was a fun and enjoyable movie, but as it was said in the first one:
The Closer you think you are, the farther you'll be.

Review title: The first cardtrick is kinda freaky!! DIF anyone guessed the wrong one???
Review_body: The first cardtrick is kinda freaky!! DIF anyone guessed the wrong one???

Review title: First movie was good, this is just bad
Review_body: I actually quite enjoyed the first movie. While unbelievable in parts, the movie as a whole was well done and entertaining. Not so for the sequel.The plot is horrid.The tricks all feel done before, are way too repetitive, and go on for far too long (things are overly complicated when they don't need to be).The few tricks that you might be impressed by, thinking how did they do that, well the answer is movie post-production cgi.First movie was good, this sequel is bad, hopefully the powers that be learned their lesson and don't green light any more.

The first movie was enjoyable, but had to believe, especially the ending. However, this piece of junk discards everything that movie worked toward. The plot twists, the misguided revenge, nothing from the first movie is retained. I made it to the end, but I had to force myself. Perfect example of taking an enjoyable premise and trashing it for the sake of a sequel.
As a matter of fact, this movie soooooooooo amazing, and It was one of the best movies I saw, i highly recommended don't miss it...

Let me start by saying that I didn't like the first "Now You See Me", but I would rate it a 6/10 just for the fact it was SOMEWHAT enjoyable. The sequel is a movie that probably nobody asked for, but yet they did it anyway. 2 hours of poorly directed and written nonsense.SOME vague spoilers ahead, though you won't care about them at all.THE PLOT The plot tries to twist and turn a couple of times, but it is just a straight line. To try and spice it up they tried the twist with Morgan Freeman's character, but nobody believed it, not even Mr. Freeman.THE MAGIC A movie about magic should not be a movie about CGI, which the first movie was and now the second. The Illusionist and The Prestige were doing their magic tricks for the audience IN the movie, for the crowd in that universe. This one does the tricks just for the people watching the movie. Need to make someone disappear? Of course there will be a cut. Need to make someone escape? They simply transform into water. How? Who cares, a magician never reveals his tricks (hint: CGI). THE LOGISTICS A bunch of random magicians can take over the whole of London on New Year's Eve in half a day without preparation. They can also somehow broadcast their tricks LIVE all over the world, on all TVs in all city centers, etc.THE PANDERING TO THE Chinese MARKET Yes I know that "entertaining" movies nowadays always have something for the Chinese market: a character, a vase, a flashback scene, etc. But this one went all in: mystical characters that know and see everything, they help the protagonists without a second thought, etc. Oh and did I mention they are literally going to China for some reason, just to show what a great place it is?THE HEIST SCENE (FLYING CARD) God please make it stop. A 10-minutes scene with a quintillion number of ways it can go wrong - everything works out. How to prevent a heist like that? A single security camera in the room and an underpaid guard watching it. Done.THE FEMALE CHARACTER Jesus Christ, don't get me started on Lizzy Caplan's character. With a couple of attempts at witty lines about misogyny and discrimination, her character was a caricature of a female character.JESSE EISENBERG No.

Review title: Just as good as the first!
Review_body: Now You See Me and Now You See Me 2 are a couple of my all time favorite movies that I keep in rotation for nights that I can find something else to watch.This one was just as good as the first although I do miss Isla Fisher. The cast is still great and they work well as a team.

Review title: It was ok, but missing Isla Fisher
Review_body: It was an alright follow up. The ending dragged on a bit. It just wasn't the same without Isla Fisher. Don't get me wrong Lizzy Caplan is good, but the movie would have been so much better with the complete original cast.

Okay, let me start by mentioning I thought the first one was good, different,less predictable especially liked how some of the tricks were explained but "The Second Act" well make it too much.I mean this isn't supposed to be a movie on fantasy. It's supposed to be real life magicians. I think the movie was too busy trying to show fancy tricks. An example is the part where they were searched they could all have hidden the card rather than throwing it around. It had some good moments too but overall predictable and average. Not bad, okay. I like magic very much, The Prestige is still one of my favourite movies so I didn't mind the mediocrities in the movie.

The cast, the trick effects and the acting are great, but in my humble opinion they are overshadowed by the plot. The biggest magic trick of this movie must have been getting approval for the script. For my taste, even being a huge fan of the "mind-f*ck" genre, this plot takes too many turns. In a good mind-f*ck movie, you should be amazed by reveals. In this movie, there are so many small reveals that I cannot even remotely recall how many there were. The last trick was the only reveal that I really appreciated. Overall, I would describe the story as unnecessarily busy. The first film in the franchise was not flawless either, but I felt emotionally more invested in the characters because the overarching story was always clear and only took a handful of twists.

If you enjoyed the first film you can't not enjoy this one, the direction is excellent; the acting is superb; the graphics are outstanding; the plot line is ingenious and tight and via science, logic and a hefty amount of money all the tricks performed are very much possible, if put together correctly. Also I think it was a great decision to replace Isla Fisher with Lizzy Caplan as I think she brings more to the role and that extra piece of comedy to the film that seemed to be missing in the previous film. Therefore, I think if you did not enjoy the first now you see me, you shouldn't even bother watching this as it'll be a waste of your time. However, if like me you enjoyed the first film then definitely go and see this movie because you will very highly likely enjoy this movie as much if not, like me, even more. I genuinely believe this is better than the first and is one of the best films I've seen.

Review title: Don't be fooled by the magic!
Review_body: Well, I have just seen Now You See Me 2 yesterday, and I was pretty let down, no, confused by the plot.And that's where we are gonna start.As a heist/magic movie, Now You See Me 2 obviously has many twists and turns in the story, just like its predecessor. But this sequel has too many twists and turns that they made the fans struggle to understand what the heck was going on. I mean, creating the Daniel Radcliffe's character was good, but making Thaddeus Bradley a good guy? That's a crazy idea! And why would he and Lionel Shrike( Dylan's father) pretend to hate each other? Thaddeus said that it had been a trick, but for what? Why Thaddeus wouldn't be a cop and why Shrike wouldn't be a thieve? They would have fooled a lot of banks and had lots of money, wouldn't they? I would rather see Lionel Shrike came back to life and said he was head of the Eye rather than Thaddeus become a good guy. One more crazy thing is, when the Horsemen found out that the chip they had stolen were fake, then how on earth could it become a real one in the end of the movie? I remembered that Walter( Oh, I remember his name now) had checked that chip and he said it was real.The plot was way too over complicated for any moviegoer to understand.Finally, I just want to say that Now You See Me 2 had truly fooled moviegoers by the magic tricks( Holy *beep*, they were stunning). If you are looking for a good movie this weekend, then skip this one( And Warcraft as well). You might be disappointed...

Review title: A nice entertaining movie albeit lacking that 'Wow' factor that made the first one memorable
Review_body: I had very high hopes for this movie after watching the first one because that movie was something new and different. It had an intriguing concept which was wonderfully portrayed on screen. The acting in that movie was solid which is a given when you have talent like Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Michael Caine and Morgan Freeman in the same movie. They all returned for this installment with only Isla Fisher being replaced by Lizzy Caplan. Then there was Daniel Radcliffe, arguably the most famous wizard in the world playing the villain of the movie. Though the irony of this was not lost on me, I felt that however much he tried, Daniel Radcliffe wasn't convincing as a villain. Lizzy Caplan was not good at all with her character being very unconvincing. To me it felt that her whole purpose in the movie was to provide that unnecessary romance subplot with Jack Wilder. This movie still brought those stunning visual effects of the first movie with my personal favorite being the scene with Jesse Eisenberg and the rain during the film's climax. The scene in the middle where the Horsemen had to steal a chip from a heavily guarded location was entertaining to see albeit illogical. I mean whim were the filmmakers trying to convince by showing that not a single guard saw the card being tossed around the room? This lack of logic spoiled what was a great scene visually. The scenes in the Chinese Magic Shop were really enjoyable. Jay Chou's character was especially good with his comedic timing. The main problem of this movie was that it got lost in setting up a convoluted plot. This made the initial half of the movie very dull and boring. Where the first movie kicked off with 4 individual scenes involving magic tricks and then the big bank heist, this one had its first real magic scene during the introduction of Lizzy Caplan's character, which was a really weak scene. This movie had very little actual tricks with actual explanations and it instead relied more on unexplained illusions. The twist that Daniel Radcliffe's character was in fact Arthur Tressler's son was a decent one even though it was a bit clichéd. What made the movie good was its climax. The climax showed us what we wanted to see from the start. Actual tricks with believable explanations which were enhanced by special effects which were a visual treat. It was a gripping climax and it used it's backdrop of the City of London quite effectively. The finale in the middle of the Thames was extremely good and was in my opinion much better than the finale in New York in the first movie. The end reveal that Thaddeus Bradley was in fact partners with Lionel Shrike and was a high ranking member of the eye did not go down well with me. It was a big plot hole for the first movie as why didn't he tell Dylan about this when he was first jailed? It made no sense. But we still got a brilliant scene between Morgan Freeman and Mark Ruffalo due to it so I can ignore that mistake. All in all, this movie is more of a typical summer entertainer rather than the thought provoking one its predecessor was. It got caught in a tad too much storytelling and illogical tricks rather than the ones with an explanation but it still delivered enough to justify there being a third installment in this franchise. This movie should be seen as more of an unrealistic entertainer with a less than average plot but with enough of the visual treat to justify spending two hours in the theater.

The film is an utterly disappointment, huge mess, broken story line, it is like a demonstration of how not to make a file. Don't waste your money or time. Now You See Me 1 was a surprised movie, it gave a great story line, good balanced character set but when it comes to Now You See Me 2 it is a totally mess, can't understand how they mess with this one. Also the story line of some characters are dull and boring. Also the director tried to mix some amusement to the film by adding Unnecessary stories, but finally the whole movie is a joke. Also I am very much worried about Daniel Radcliffe's decisions to select such movies. He has a great acting ability but he is now wasting that talent. Hope there will not be any further sequels based on this concept.

Review title: Not a bust sequel but nothing special
Review_body: It was enjoyable to watch as Lizzy definitely add more comedic taste as oppose to Isla which is a plus. My complaint would have to be the plot. This is where the spoilers begins: it makes no sense at all that Morgan Freeman is a good guy at the end of the movie. Movies nowadays fell into a trend of trilogy but by having Morgan Freeman to be a good guy at the end. Like who on Earth are willing to go to jail for a year just because I felt the truth will hurt Mark!!?? The twist really felt forced, like Freeman is a good guy because he's Freeman. I felt they missed out on an epic storyline if they were to film part three. Second, I thought the chip was a fake!? I thought the ending would be Woody hypnotize his twin brother and then trade places with him to hypnotize Michael and Daniel because his twin did a weird clap on the airplane when telling the henchmen to throw them out of the plane. The chip turning out to be real was really weird.

Now you see me 2 is a movie where the start line keeps you guessing just what is really happening. It makes you pay great attention to detail and everything in the movie so you can try to figure out what is going on because the director, Jon Chu did a great job of hiding the secrets that help the horsemen complete their stub its and keep them from falling apart. It is a movie of many quick cuts, pans and zooms to try to hint at how tge horsemen are completing their stunning tricks and to keep your eye away form them sometimes so that for most viewers the story doesn't come together until the end, so they will stay on the edge of their seats. It does a great job of making you feel as though the villains have the upper hand and are going to win and flipping everything around to show that the heros have been in control the whole time even if they may not have known it.

If you want a movie about magicians, and are not 12 years old, I'll recommend The Illusionist or The Prestige. If you like superhero movies - watch one of those. This is kind of a mix.I guess what I'm trying to say is:If you like movies that are fast paced, where they try to cram as much as possible into the movie in as little time as possible, kind of a movie directed by a hamster or something, then you'll probably like this movie.If you suspension of disbelief comes easy to you, then you'll also like it. Because there is really nothing very believable in it. All the magic tricks smell of CGI and "movie", and there is never doubt whether it's gonna work or not.
An updated fairytale among good and bad interesting tricks in the plot.. very good direction.. they were some gaps in the end.. but the message came through.

So, I noticed a college of mine had a bigger boat than I, so I decided to make a new movie. I called Marvel and asked if they had any more superheroes. They said they had one that transformed into an ant, but I thought that sounded a bit weak and decided to start from scratch. Having only seen the interiors of Hollywood mansions for the past 20 years I thought it was time to reconnect to humanity and I took my jet to Las Vegas and watched a Magic show for 10 minutes. Bingo! I had an idea. I called the studio and told them and they asked if there was going to be real Star Wars super magic, but I said no, regular card stuff. They told me I needed more CGI to appeal to the common man, I said sure, - how about an animated card flying around for 20 mins? That will also compensate for the lack of a real story. We brainstormed for 15 more minutes and came up with many brilliant ideas and here you are, my latest masterpiece. Now I can finally afford that bigger boat. And thank you, common man, for your 7 point review and all your money. You give me hope of a better tomorrow. now on to the 3-qual to explore those depths and fill in the gaps left out of this one.
I don't know, why I've watched this after the first one was meh. Number two was really number two. Total nonsense and waste of time.

Big letdown from the first one. Too many twists one on top of each other, and gives the impression that the writer was trying too hard on this one. A classic example of overthinking. The card scene was bordering on absurdity, not to mention the airplane trick. Like nobody on the plane noticed? Seriously? Not even during takeoff? Ridiculous!
It's good, not as good as the original but it's a worthy sequel. It's also the only movie you get the hulk fighting Harry Potter and alfred.

Review title: Has to be compared to the first part and definitely can't keep up here
Review_body: The film's biggest flaw is clearly the rather lengthy and inspired storyline. The storyline is an absolute mess.The acting is great, of course this amazing cast. Even when I'm alone with it, I found Lizzy Caplan as Lula terrible, super uncomfortable and just plain annoying. I swear it pissed me off at times. I also find the Antargonist, played by Daniel Radcliffe, far too one-dimensional. Everything else in this film is neat and solid (e.g. The film music). On the positive side, the visual effects, which look incredibly strong, are definitely to be emphasized.

Review title: Intrigue, misguidance and not necessarily what you've expected.
Review_body: -The following will not reveal any spoilers above those presented in any trailer-Alright. Let's start at the beginning. You've probably seen the first one. Intrigue, misguidance and not necessarily what you've expected.Well strap in because this one is somewhat close to it's predecessor. I know a lot of people already think of this as "the evil step brother" of the first one.Let me tell you: It is not! Is this one as exciting as the first one? No it is not. Why, you ask? Well, because it's not the first one! You already know the way this movie is going to work. This is not the kind of cinema that will reinvent the wheel. But it will do it's best to get as close to it as possible? Absolutely!You will see the same kind of surprises (plot wise) that you got in the first one and a good bit more that you DID NOT expect. This is what this movie is about. It, by definition as a sequel, can't be as surprising as the first one (look at the Ocean's series). But it damn sure gets pretty damn close, so let's make that clear from the get go. However, will you be entertained? Heck yes you will! From the beginning of the movie, I tried to anticipate every move the crew makes. Did I do well? Nope. Did I enjoy myself? You better be sure I did!If you go into a sequel, expecting the genre to be redefined, I'm sorry, but it's your own fault. If you go into it, trying to enjoy yourself, you definitely will be entertained!I hope you have a great viewing experience!

This movie felt like an extended episode of Scorpion. The same contrived humour and feel good unnecessaries. Alex Kurtzman & Roberto Orci have bombarded us with this absolutely unoriginal piece of garbage. Mark Ruffalo & Jesse Eisenberg have really dropped their standards here. This totally seems like a forced studio movie which they were contractually obliged to do.There is maybe 20 minutes of this movie that should have made it to the final cut and even this is mainly special effects. But with a run time of 2 hours this was a pain to watch. The story really went no where and left you thinking -- seriously? Have no idea how it is at such a high rating on IMDb.

This is a stupid movie! It is just as bad as the first one was good!
Unbelieveable bad script, like really, really awful.

Review title: Best Sequel I've Seen In A Long Time!!!
Review_body: I was iffy walking into the theater about the second movie. I fell in love with the first one and I knew nothing could top it. I'm going to be honest, it starts out slow but give it at max 10-15 minutes in and I was hooked! It's been a very long time since I've seen a really good movie sequel! I loved Isla Fisher in the first movie but the new girl Lizzy is hilarious! She adds humor where Isla to me really didn't it was more sass than anything. I was also worried about Daniel Radcliff being in this movie but I was proved wrong he did really good for his part in the movie. I was impressed overall with the second movie. A lot of plot twists! I wish there was a bit more magic but the finale and a couple of tricks made up for that ;)

Review title: Thrilling, Clever, and Magical! Awesome Sequel...
Review_body: I'm a big fan of the first Now You See Ms (2013) with its great surprise ending. The combination of magic tricks mixed with crime always intrigued me,can't you'll get it all here with this sequel. I went to see this today with my sister and it was great. The plot was just as smart and suspenseful, the acting was great, and the graphics - especially the scene with the rain - were mesmerizing. The Four Horsemen deliver a whole new level of magic tricks, deception, and fun. Lots of crime and action in this sequel. It's just as great as its original and fills in a lot of missing info. Definitely go see it! I give it 10 stars for its cleverness, suspense, great action scenes, and overall an epic ride with The Four Horsemen.

This movie was phenomenal! There is nothing more exciting than a sequel that is equal to the original!! This movie does exactly that! I cannot wait for it to come out on DVD!! I honestly did not think it could be as good as the original but I was pleasantly surprised...over and over! In true magician's fashion, you never see it coming!! My daughters absolutely could not get enough of this sequel. Woody Harrelson does an amazing job with his character and Lizzy Caplan fit right in with the Four Horsemen. I highly recommend you make a day of excitement, starting with this!! You won't be disappointed!! The acting is superb. The writing, excellent. The energy, never ending!! Enjoy!!

I like the fact that unlike many new movies, it is slow and has meaningful conversations and smooth transitions. Compared to it's prequel it has less actions and chasings but still has good magic tricks. I love the movie but the way the story ended, had me unsatisfied and in my opinion, it is the weakest part of the whole series. I wish it had a better ending, storywise.

Now You See Me 2 continues the narrative of the first film well, however does not add much to the lore of the series or match the quality of its predecessor.The best ingredient of the film is the cast. The actors and actresses involved work really well together to create charming chemistry and characters. Unfortunately, there are so many actors involved that some are ultimately wasted/short changed. Michael Caine and Jay Chou are among the first few billed for the film, yet they have little development and do not add much to the story.One aspect of the film I cannot criticize is the action. It is well paced and choreographed, boding together "magic" and realistic brawls. Furthermore, the magic/stunts in the film are exceptional and entertaining to watch, despite how ridiculous they really are.The main problem with the film is the actual story and how everything comes together. The story darts around from arc to arc whilst clumsily trying to continue the events of the first film and carry a new story all-together. This results in a disappointing third act as well as out-of-place scenes peppered throughout the movie. Now You See Me 2 is missing the magic of the first film to make it a really good film, however utilizes the majority of the cast and set pieces well to aid a struggling story.6/10

Review title: Terrible wandering sequel that contradicts the first film
Review_body: The first "Now You See Me" was thoughtful, well-cast, well-acted, and well-told. Most of the magic was explained, leaving just enough *not* to please the viewer and enhance the sense of mystery and wonder that all fans of stage magic and street magic will appreciate. This film is a typical sequel that tried to best the previous film and failed dismally.I will not give anything away if you want to see many of the characters again. However, if you are expecting a fascinating plot that makes any sense when you review it later, you will be disappointed. The beloved characters from the first film are sorely abused in this trite follow-up. Instead of following along and learning more as you go, with surprises along the way, this plot is so contrived as to defy belief in a great many places. The reveals are often trifling and superficial, the connections are implausible at best, and the motives and personal growth from the first film are abandoned completely in favor of "shock" and "wow" visuals, which still fail to impress. A few humorous moments in the film are drowned by the meandering story line, and I was left feeling both annoyed and betrayed in the end. I am always surprised when sequels turn out well, as some do, but this was a waste of film, and I urge you to skip it if you are reading this review beforehand. Enjoy the first and let your imagination run wild, instead.

Review title: the closer you look, the less you see!
Review_body: Made me believe that magic is real. I was awed. Made me WOW the entire time watching this. Waiting for part 3

Review title: Read this if you liked the first movie and expect the same or slightly worse.
Review_body: This movie is so messed up on so many levels. It was a complete waste of money. I do not usually write reviews but writing a negative review for this movie actually makes me feel better after what the movie did to me. I watched the first movie only hours before this one and that was much better/smarter/funnier than this one. The jokes in this movie are ridiculous and the plot does not make any sense. So many things that you look at do not make any sense for a normal human being to digest. There are many scenes that it looks like they were trying too hard to be entertaining or funny. On top of the the acting is TERRIBLE. The script is TERRIBLE. There are many point when actors even look directly at the camera, loss of continuity in scenes. It was as if the director was too lazy to record extra takes for badly shot scenes. I was bored for the first 3/4 of the movie. The ending is slightly more energetic but can do nothing to save this movie from being an utter disaster.

I made an account just to review this movie. This is one of the worst I've ever seen. Complete junk. I spent $4 to watch this on Redbox and wish I could file for a refund.
It's. That. Bad.

Review title: I liked it, but it lacked most of the cleverness of the first
Review_body: The first "Now You See Me" was a personal guilty pleasure, it was fun, fast-paced and clever, with the help of a talented cast, good characters, and a complex story. The sequel didn't have the same clever elements of the first, and there was a subplot about a twin of one of the characters that added nothing to the film - if they had left that out in favor of a different conflict they might have had room for something else - perhaps an ending more like the first, with a lot more flash and spectacle. Oh, and Woody Harrelson in a wig, playing a fey version of himself - not a good idea. If they are in fact doing a third, they'd be wise to look at the first again.

I thoroughly enjoyed the first NYSM, and was really looking forward to the sequel. I have seen all the issues folks have with plot holes, and character conflicts. I get their points. While watching, they didn't really matter. I wasn't expecting great art. I went expecting a fun heist film, and it delivered. I enjoyed trying to figure out the illusions, and making guesses about who was behind the heist. Radcliffe talking offhandedly about magic was kind of a giggle. With all the drama in the news these days, this was a welcome escape. I hope the rumored third film gets made. I will go see it, too. Give NYSM2 a whirl, it will be fun.

Daniel Radcliffe is in this movie, so that's pretty cool... aside from that, everything else is a downgrade from the first movie. The characters are less interesting, the dialogue isn't clever or funny, Woody Harrelson's second role is annoying and the most important aspect of any film about magicians or "magic", the explanation of their performance a.k.a. the twist, is lazy and makes no sense. I liked the first movie of the franchise. I didn't think it was fantastic, but definitely entertaining. The second movie made me furious at times because they seemed to think that trying to outdo every twist of the first movie would guarantee the second movie to be good. It didn't. They bombard you with these twists that don't make sense, leaving you thinking "so at this point anything is possible because anything can be a twist". You get a sensation of not fearing for the main characters because everything happening on the screen will be negated at some point of the movie. You expect every bad twist, you only wonder what illogical explanation they're going to offer this time.

Review title: Isla Fisher must be the only person who read the script
Review_body: Very simply this movie is riding on the shoulders and expectation following the first film and on an all star cast.We are introduced to a new character early on with no real explanation as to the absence of Isla Fisher's character, I think the most plausible explanation is that Isla Fisher must be the only person who actually read the script before filming started!If you ignore my advice and still watch this, then prepare to have your disbelief suspended, battered into screaming submission and then vomited onto the floor.BTW Daniel Radcliffe must have been penciled in for his role just as a joke at the planning stage, but tragically made it into the actual film. Radcliffe is Harry Potter and shouldn't be let close to anything that relates to magic, you just spend the whole film thinking "OMG Harry has turned pretty nasty, hmm he does look better with contact lenses though, I wonder when is he going to pull his wand out and cast a pointless spell?"

the first movie was good, i love it in fact. All the tricks were kinda impossible, but at least its all make sense after they showed us how they did it and added with an interesting plot twist at the end. Now you see me 2, however, went to the next level of bull tricks and meaningless story line with "crunchy" jokes. It was boring and confusing. I wasted 2 hours for nothing. I used to think that the characters in the first movie were good and well tough out - they were good as a team and fun to be watched. Now, they are just annoying and try soooo hard to look cool with their crappy dialogue and outrageous tricks. Its a movie about magicians right? Not witches nor wizards. I mean, can they really throwing cards from one to another without anyone noticing? Can a card slide through your body that easily?To summarise, the movie is bad in everything (story line, acting, dialogue) Don't even bother to watch it.

Review title: The first one wasn't good but this one really sucks
Review_body: I remember not liking the first one, but still spending an okay- time. I remember thinking it was "too much" but still, I managed to find some things to appreciate. So after hesitating a little, I decided to try this one, because I wanted to watch the kind of movie where you can disconnect your brain and enjoy. Even though my expectations were very low.. it was awful.I watched the movie with a friend... we laughed a lot. But only once or twice because of the dialogues and numerous jokes... the rest was us mocking... well everything. The plot, the "twists", the "jokes"... Mainly, the problem is the scenario... nothing is coherent, and the worse is that the film wants to give the impression that it's really smart. Directing is chaotic and messy in order to make you feel lost and to make you think it's so intelligent that you can't follow everything. But the truth is everything is stupid and lacks credibility. Some movies are doing too much on purpose and it's okay as long as they are not taking themselves too seriously. But here it's the opposite, and I feel like the director is insulting my intelligence.I could also comment one some scenes but I don't want to "spoil", especially one that last 10 minutes and brings nothing. It just highlights how stupid is the script. The scene is supposed to be impressive with special effects but makes no sense. It's just an excuse to put as much special effects and "magic" as possible.I'm stopping now because criticizing this movie can take hours. The three stars left? I think it's for Morgan Freeman (you have to love him even in dumb movies), the musics and the laugh I had mocking it.

I actually think this one is better than the first one, but I am sorry, it still sucks so much. I gave this film two stars because it was better than the first film, that just sucks in every way. This film actually had some feelings, it had some heart, but still, it just did NOT make sense! So stupid premise, so little purpose, so bad acting (except Michael Kane). I am Sorry, but this is just a bad film, and I hope you did not pay anything for it.

Review title: Dull, cheap and no where near the prequel
Review_body: While the first installation was enjoyable, the second one does not live up. The plot was bland and dull and dragging. The dialogue was dry and just downright stupid. The magic tricks were OK (and unnecessary), but there was no wow factor. No jaw-dropping revealing or mind hack or anything like that. If the first movie keeps you guessing until the final scene, then Now You See Me 2 just basically tells the whole story in a straight line. It's just plain badTo pair with the bad plot, the acting was also horrid. Lizzy Caplan was beyond tragic. There is no charisma in her character at all. Replacing Isla Fisher was a really bad move. And when you thought: "Well, at least Michael Caine or Morgan Freeman will provide some top-notch acting?", you were wrong. Their characters are just so dull that even their talents can not save them.

Review title: Not majestic, but everything you'd expect
Review_body: Not as well as the first Now You See Me but still includes everything you'd expect! (Kinda reminds me of Avengers vs Age of Ultron, everyone still loved the 2nd one anyway) Even though the 2nd movie have changed its style (instead of doing magic performances for revenge), I think it's going towards a better direction, like the fast&furious sequel. Lots of magic tricks, lots of mind blowing scenes, actions, and funny AF. Jay Chou was a great addition to be added into the film crew. I'm glad that I was able to get invited to watch a pre-screening of this movie. I certainly hope that there's a NYSM 3 that's coming in a few years. Magicians really deserve some serious credit, with the amount of work they are putting into every magic trick they do.

Review title: Ocean's Eleven, except without the charm, or the wit, or anything really.
Review_body: Let's start by saying that the first Now You See Me left me disappointed, but I was able to see how some people might enjoy it as brainless entertainment. I am a big con and heist movie fan, and NYSM and its sequel are obviously inspired by the likes of the Ocean's trilogy, Inside man and The Prestige. The first grabbed my interest with various tricks and twists which left questions that I was expecting to be answered in the movie's final act. The first movie contained nothing of the sort, but what was left was a decent amount of visual effects and good acting to make a fun experience, even if it did leave a bitter after taste.So it feels ironic that Now You See Me 2 fails because it tried to explain itself.Without spoiling the movie, I will sum up the story like this: The squad from the first movie (with a subbed in girl member played by Lizzy Caplan) is outsmarted by a "shadow organization" that is out to get them. Two men that stand out from that organization are the snobby millionaire played by Daniel Radcliffe and Woody Harrelson's character's twin brother played by Woody himself. Radcliffe does a good job playing his part, and Harrelson does what I suppose is the best he could do with his added role, seeing as it is probably one the worst written characters this year. I say "one of the worst" because it definitely isn't as bad as the new girl member of the team. "Lula" is supposed to be an illusionist worthy of the world's most secret magician society, yet she acts like an edgy 16 year old, desperately crushing on Dave Franco's character. This, together with the movie's plot, make the first two acts play out like a cartoon, with no logic or decent motivation behind any of the characters.The magic, I should note, looks great, the visual effects and direction are not ground breaking, but are certainly well done. Yet, as in the previous movie, it is literal MAGIC. Most of the big illusions in this movie are left unexplained, and those that aren't, should have been. Why? Well, perhaps because the writers of this movie seem to think that walking up to someone on the street and snapping your fingers at them is a legitimate way to hypnotize people, or that flashing a person with a UV lit text that says SLEEP will knock them out indefinitely. When an explanation serves its purpose only within the twisted reality of it's movie, it is safe to say that it isn't really a smart explanation, and that this really is not a smart movie, even if it acts otherwise.My friends and I left the theater laughing, dazed by the silliness of this movie. Would not recommend.

The movie already had set up huge expectations since the production of it began. Sadly, it fell very short of what it should've carried on.There were some wonderful fighting scenes throughout the movie, in fact more action than the predecessor. There was also more humor to the movie, thanks to the introduction of Lizzy Caplan and the terrific acting by Woody Harrison.Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Morgan Freeman and Dave Franco did a job which was as good as the first part, and definitely was enjoyable. The acting was so good that the audience, and especially me, did not miss Isla Fisher one bit.The horrible disappoint was the awful display of Daniel Radcliffe and Michael Caine. The roles they played definitely did not suit them AT ALL. Throughout the movie there was one scene which amazed me and the audience, otherwise the movie was just awful display of it predecessor. It's sad to see movies with a wonderful cast line up not live up to its expectations.

Review title: Nowhere close to the first film
Review_body: Before I start bashing this movie let me tell you,I loved the first movie and I was very excited for this one.The all A-list cast made it even more interesting,but right from the first act it was a big letdown.The four horsemen's charm weren't magical anymore.Even Mark Ruffalo's character wasn't interesting anymore.The big secret of The eye was a joke.The plot seemed to be rushed, characters were poorly developed.Except few scenes I wanted the movie to be over as soon as possible.Third is the series is coming and I am no more interested in it.It doesn't matter how big names you got in your movie,story do matter too. Review title: Look Closer and You Will See
Review_body: Now You See Me 2 is the caper thriller film that is directed by Jon M. Chu, the film is the sequel to the 2013 film Now You See Me. Jesse Eisenberg, Dave Franco, Woody Harrelson, Mark Ruffalo, Michael Caine and Morgan Freeman all reprise their roles from the previous film, new cast members are Lizzy Caplan and Daniel Radcliffe.I found the film to be fun and taking the characters in new directions. Adding new characters, new story and locations the film offers something for everyone.Check out the review for Now You See Me 2 https://filmorder.wordpress.com/2016/07/05/now-you-see-me-now-2/

Review title: Only card seen is best other is garbage
Review_body: I like first first part of movie but in this movie does not affect and only one card seen is best other not good

Review title: Great but not as good as the first
Review_body: This is a really great movie but it definitely lacked the flair that the first one had. The magic tricks were great but it kind of sucked how they explained the magic tricks. Woody Harrelson is one of my favourite actors but for some odd reason he played two characters in this film. Jesse Eisenberg also plays a great character and performs some good tricks. Dave Franco's character is just awesome and I must admit that I have been practicing throwing cards at different targets. Daniel Radcliffe plays the villain in this movie which was unexpected but he seriously needs to lose the beard. My God Morgan Freeman and Michael Caine are good actors and I was actually pretty surprised when Morgan Freeman turned out to be the good guy at the end. Lizzy Caplan was a good replacement for Isla FIsher and managed to pull off some very humorous scenes. All in all this was a great movie but lacked the tricks that were in the first movie.

Review title: As good as the first one... Maybe?
Review_body: I liked this movie despite the disadvantages it had. The star of the film was still Jesse Eisenberg (who was still brilliant as Atlas) but we got to see more of the other two Horsemen (both Dave Franco and Woody Harrelson were great to watch). The new girl Horseman, Lula, was good. Sometimes she was on the verge of being annoying, but on the whole, she was likable and definitely had a solid character whereas Henley (Isla Fisher from the first film) didn't leave much of an impression on me. Even so, I don't think the Horsemen had the same kind of camaraderie as in the first film. Daniel Radcliffe was interesting to watch. His scenes were always fun, he has a particular knack for doing the simplest things and making them funny. Sometimes though, I got the feeling he wasn't even acting, that he had wandered onto the set and was just being himself. The film seemed to have a fairly simple plot but it tended to wander off. It was definitely sometimes tricky to understand what exactly was happening. I think there's two things that contributed to that - 1) the pace; sometimes several things were revealed to the audience too quickly for them to process fully, and 2) the dialogue. Again, this had to do with the pace, it was just too quick sometimes. My last point, the magic. It was great. It was so exciting and exhilarating to watch them do impossible things (even if they're not real). Not all of their tricks are explained in the film but I think I prefer it that way.

Let me put this straight, this season 2 totally sucks compared to the season 1. The few magic scenes are disappointing. The first magic-show scene is still attractive, but then nothing about magic happens till the final show. In season 1, magic scenes run through the whole movie, and all those magics work perfectly and reasonably. In season 2, it's more like a action movie with many street fights. The new characters are plain unnecessary. Let's say, the appearance of Lula aims at the gender balance. Right, it's important. None of us wants to see a movie without a beautiful face. So, what's the point of the two Chinese characters, that grandma and grandson? I believe the plot goes fluently even though the director cuts out all their scenes. Those trivial characters just distract the audiences' attention from the Horse Men and make the plot dragging and embarrassing. Combined with the lack of magic and additional characters, the plot becomes so distractive that some of the logic mistakes become so confusing. Like, the Horse Men have nothing in Macau, no money, no magic tools, no identity. They are under the supervision and can't leave the city. However, after they save their leader, they are free to go. They suddenly travel to London and have enough time and everything to prepare their final show. By then, they are still required by the FBI and chased by the villains.

Review title: boring .. one big failed low budget flop
Review_body: i would like to start this with the usual compliment of something in film but,, this has nothing worth mentioning. the characters are generic and corny.. it turns into a dumb story about the dad that died in the safe. Morgan and Mark have a bonding scene that is cringe-worthy, bad, corny,, almost gives you a "give a break" moment... the one that makes you get up and go ask for your money back do yourself a favor and avoid the aggravation, just skip this one.Also the new girl they use is too "Disney" and Woody H plays twins,, badly acted and inconsistent to the plot and both just come across just annoying. Poor Radcliffe tries to add his boyish charm but ends up going down with this ship,,

Review title: The reason not to make sequels.
Review_body: So disappointing I actually "signed up" to say so. Where as the first movie was a compelling "new" adventure, unfortunately the writers (or someone) really ran out of inspiration for this edition. I held in there till the end, just to see how it ended, wasting more precious moments I can never get back. Why? Muddied story line, reliance on "action" to carry the film, with ridiculously long, unnecessary sequences. How long really can you watch grown adults play hide the parcel (card / super chip)before it becomes nothing more than a time filler. Wait to contemplate watching once it comes to TV / Free to Air / Cable, before you waste you hard earned dollars on it.
Emotion tops! Thats it! 💟You know THE cliffs before. But they tweaked it to another level AGAIN!
Van monitoring the Horsmen is clearly in London, a City in England, which is part of The Soveriegn Nation of Great Britain. The FBI has no jurisdiction in another Nation.

Review title: Y'all a bunch of Pretentious wannabes
Review_body: The story was good, the jokes fantastic, the magic amazing. This movie was entertainment what its suppose to be. Y'all hate on anything that makes "movie magic". I despise this, "let's make everything realistic". Get off your high horse you losers.

Review title: Top 5 worst movies I have ever paid for.
Review_body: This movie was so poorly written, I felt the need to make as many people aware to avoid paying for it. I think I have written a handful of reviews but here is my short take on it...It was a story line that never developed, childish "illusions," and attempts at humor that made me roll my eyes. The characters were painful to watch act as the lines and script was so awkward, they could not even make it look good. My friend summarized the "entertainment" best by imitating the illusions saying, "It's not in this hand because look! It's in my other hand!" That corny. I watched two different couples walk out before they delivered some illogical obnoxious explanation on the "eye" and then my friend and I walked out asthey continued to explain. The first movie was very entertaining but this may be the worst sequel ever produced.

A big giant stinking pile of disappointment. An awful, anger inducing, over the top, dumb movie. Save yourself some precious time by not watching or wasting away your money on this. There was nothing clever about this movie; just stupid painted all over it. I didn't even care for the movie to finish. The longer I watched it the more stupider it felt. They try to make it look like more than it is, and yet its not. The magic trick of this movie is.. tricking you into handing your money over for nothing. The acting, the music, the story... a turd served in a steaming bowl of chow mien. The only reason they made this dumb movie is to fleece the people of their money.

I loved the first one and loved this one too. I agree that you have to suspend all belief in reality while watching this. It is strictly for entertainment purposes only. You can't take any of it seriously or try to wonder too much about why the chip was fake one minute and then real the next? Hmmm. I'd really like to point out that Isla Fisher is a good actress, but she brought nothing to the first movie. She was eye candy. She is better suited for a different type of movie. Lizzy Caplan nailed it and was terrific! Also many previous reviewers didn't mention a new character, Chase, Woody Harrelson's twin brother, who is hysterical and reminds me of mixture of Owen Wilson and somebody I can't quite peg. Anywho, it was great if you loved the first, easy to follow if you understood the first and followed the firsts plot which was nice. Loved the ending! Wish I knew what was down that spiral staircase!!!!! I bet it's amazing!

I'll start by saying you'll probably need to watch the 1st part over again, it was difficult for me to remember who is who, the script should probably have included some sort of 'reminder'?
It is not a movie for oscar nominations nor will it be memorable but is entertaining all the same, a typical 'pop corn movie'. Nothing bad about it.
Some of the plot could have been simplified a bit, it looks like the writer needed to add some spice but it got a bit overdone.
Do not try to think what can be possible or not, is just a movie, a make believe thing to pass the time, not a tutorial video for magician :D

Since the first movie, I have been waiting for this one impatiently. As the movie started, it amazed me with all the magic tricks and the incidents going on. It was absolutely perfect to watch, until the end. After all the effort the horsemen showed through the film the ending was like: OK, let's make the horsemen do all these stuff and after it's done they will feel like ONE and think they have accomplished something. For me the ending became a disgrace and it was a disappointment. To sum up the plot turned into a thing like: There is this community called "the eye" and they create a problem and then they find new people to replace themselves which should first solve the problem they created without knowing that the eye created it. And through the process they also help for the problem to be unsolved. The question is why did you act like the villain in the first place! It is a movie worth watching yet it didn't really fulfill my expectations.

Now you see me 2 sadly lost me in the opening minutes because of it's lack of depth. poor character buildups, weak plot, predictability and simply a let down from the first movie.

NYSM2 is no where near the prequel. Few wow factors and jaw dropping scenes. Dialogues are dry and unnecessary. The new horseman tries too hard to be liked. I re-watched 1 after getting home from theater. I am sure that when filming 1, Bradley was set to be a villain without doubts. Filmmakers wanted to make more money but ran out of ideas so they stupidly changed the character. I regret to watch this movie because not only it's poor written and acted, also it ruins my good memory of the prequel :(
