Review title: It's a Parody - And People Missed That
Review_body: If you have any intelligence at all, you will, not only by seeing on IMDB page it says "COMEDY", but also, find by watching the film that is is a PARODY. For instance, there's (the actor of) Harry Potter that doesn't believe in magic and believes in science instead.The issue is though that in my opinion, FIRSTLY it should've tried even harder to make things go overboard, with all the effects and stuff. I mean the CGI is exactly the point to the parody -- but people also mistook it for a serious film because the film doesn't go crazy enough with it. SECONDLY, it's should've parodied all the characters heavier. The characters clearly are meant for parody as well but they don't strike you like that hard enough leaving the experience a little blunt.Don't skip the film just because unintelligent kids here couldn't figure out it's a parody.Overall, it's decent entertainment if you understand you are watching a comedy (parody), not a serious mystery film which it clearly doesn't claim to be.

Review title: All I want to do was getting out from the cinema
Review_body: This movie is sucks.All i want to do during the movie was getting out from the cinema and prefer to not wasting my 2-hours for this movie.I am adoring the first sequel (Now You See Me), and expecting a better (or even the same) quality as the first, but i found it should be better not making the sequel. You will find the story was really look being forced from the first series (as if they forced to make this second series, maybe because of the first one shocking popularity).Cinematography are bad, it sounds like i've been watching a cheesy movies, really really far from the great first one by Larry Fong and Mitchell Amundsen.Jay Chou, who finally are being included in the Hollywood movie poster, only made a 2-3 minutes' appearance (so, why make him show in the poster as like he will become an important role?)And plus, Daniel Radcliffe's acting made this film even worse.I suggest you who love the first sequel, pretty sure to not spend your money and your precious 2-hours just for this (below) standard movie. Until now, i still regret for what i watched yesterday.

this movie is nothing but crab and I will explain: 1- actors seems very confident all the time and others(audience in the show) very stupid and this mean there is no sense and emotions in the movie at all> 2- movie try to be clever (in SAW way) by bring new actor every time and looks he is the one who is responsible about everything happened, what a silly idea 3- trick make nonsense at all (which is a disaster here) I mean they just make illogical things and after the tricks done they made illogical explanation to make it work, you can find these things in kids books only.4- anything unexplained they said you we did it by "Hypnosis", WTF if you no aware how logic works just call it Science fiction and bring every alien idea about flying things and and no need to explain what happens because we know it was Science fiction movie after all.

Now You See Me 2 can be equated with the last slurps of a snow cone, where there is no flavor left, but you finish it anyhow. Now You See Me was one of those refreshing works that always left you wanting for more. It has to be said that the sequel to the 2013 amazing movie was far from impressive. If the makers had the idea that dazzling the viewers with a lot of hyperbolic cinematography was the way to go, they were sadly mistaken. The many small and episodic routines that were to culminate in to some sort of a grand Finale which were supposed to wow the viewers fell short of achieving that. All things considered, the worst part of the movie has to be Lizzy Caplan's way below average acting and presence in the movie. The movie could have been a little better without her lackluster performance and over the top hollow effort to outshine Isla Fischer (which made her look even more miserable), and hopefully she is given the sack if the makers of the franchise ever plan to redeem themselves with another movie after the second not so indulging effort.

Alma Dray, the French Interpol agent was simply nowhere to be found. And why would they replace one horseman just because she isn't able to act? Is there no better reason? The first movie was much better in my honest opinion.Also, as compared to the first movie, this movie had so little "magic" in it. It really lacked the wow/surprise factor. I enjoyed the first movie a lot more because it was very entertaining, whereas this movie has a lot of conversation and action than magic. I believe the theme changed into more of an action film than a magic-show film.And Jay Chou... Why is he even inside? For marketing purposes to appeal to the Chinese crowd? Beats me. 5/10. Could do much better.

Review title: The magic tricks were damn cool but the story was sloppy.
Review_body: The film was pretty fun and worth watching, Jesse Eisenberg and Woody Harrelson were amazing, but the plot really needed to be polished, the motivations were just abrupt. The narrative structure of this one was pretty similar to the last one but only sloppier. If I could I would give this film a 7.5, but since there was no such option and it really couldn't hit 8... Anyway it was still a cool film. Jesse Eisenberg was cool as hell. I'm totally willing to watch the film again just for him, and of course Woody Harrelson. Other supporting roles were also good and the magic tricks they showed were just brilliant and tremendously interesting. Although the ending was fallacious, I liked and enjoyed the film in general.

This was absolutely atrocious. I really liked the first one so I went to see this as soon as possible hoping for more but it seems like they doubled down on all the things people hated about the first movie. The magic tricks were much more CG heavy, the story-line was absurd and confusing, and worst of all the tone of the film was completely different. I love Lizzy Caplan but everything about her in this movie I hated. Everything about her character enforced the idea that we were no longer in a realistic movie and everything became slapstick and silly. The first movie had a "real world" feel. As soon as Woody Harrelson's 'Brother' appeared I pretty much checked out. I cant overstate how much I hated this.

Well, First thing when I watched this movie was horrible, because of my friends summary when they were already watched it before me. But, when i saw all the whole things, i find out that this movie is really great and very entertaining. Although the plot is easy to guess, but it's quite good for me. It's sad that Henley Reeves not play in this movie, but actually love the whole story from the beginning until the end of this movie. The first Now You See Me was very very good because we don't know the story where to ends and the unpredictable culprit. But this movie is the second one, enjoy it. I watched it yesterday with my friends, 3 of us really liked and enjoy the show, but the 2 of us didn't like it much. Haha

Review title: If you want a fast paced, exciting and funny movie packed with incredible visuals, WATCH THIS
Review_body: I was saddened to see that Now You See Me 2 is rated poorly both on IMDb and Rotten Tomatoes. I saw it in cinemas yesterday and it was one of the best movies I have seen in a while, and the two people I went with agreed. I also thought that visually, humour-wise and acting-wise, this movie was better than its predecessor. The visuals are, as usual, incredible. The effects are fantastic and I love the way they show all of the tricks. It's exciting, intense and a bit over dramatic, but hey, that's what you get from the Now You See Me franchise, and I love it. Not only this, but it has a fantastic soundtrack and what can only be described as 'cool' sound effects. They are well placed and frankly, awesome! People are accusing this movie of being overly-CGI, having a bloated plot and being worse than the original, which in my opinion is ridiculous! Obviously it's going to be loaded with CGI - it's a movie about magicians and illusionists! It's far cheaper to use CGI than to actually do the tricks. Not only this, but I failed to find a problem with the CGI. It was done well, not too excessively and definitely used to the movie's advantage. The plot was most certainly not bloated, it had a thoroughly enjoyable and entertaining plot arc and the characters were each well developed ( well, as developed as they could have been in this rather fast moving movie). I liked it better than the original. I loved the addition of Lizzy Caplan replacing Isla Fischer (which was done smoothly), and the new objective of the Four Horsemen (which again I won't go into, but was exciting, hilarious and at times even emotional). The acting was great, there weren't any phenomenal performances however, again, this is simply not the type of movie that you go to if you want to watch some great classic or moving story, you go to it to have a good time and to have fun. One standout performance for me was Mark Ruffalo's, but I won't say why because it will breach guidelines and become a spoiler, most likely. Dave Franco's performance as always was charming, Jesse Eisenberg's was funny, Daniel Radcliffe was also great, and of course Morgan Freeman and Michael Caine were fantastic. My one reservation was that it was rather predictable. I won't say any specific plot points just in case of spoilers, but I did figure out the basic plot arc before the halfway mark. Then again, this is Now You See Me, and something I loved about these movies was how they can take a basic plot and turn it into something spectacular. If you liked the previous Now You See Me then I'm sure you'll love this. If I were to describe it I'd describe it as Inception, but with less of a tragic backstory and more of a funny, exciting and dramatic plot line and characters. I loved it and cannot wait for Now You See Me 3!

It's contain bigger and near-impossible magic than the first movie. The casts are well-known, and the film's visual effects & humor was amazing and fresh. I surprised by the director, Mr. Jon M. Chu, in his mind and work to make this great film. The story was told in unique ways and I amazed by the tricks they're used to, the characters are complete each other, and I was speechless by the last trick, what I think is completely different, amazing!. I though this is the best film I saw in the last 6 months, and I hope there will be a sequel, or a prequel about The Four Horsemen's backgrounds. Sorry for bad English, and thanks Now You See Me 2, for entertaining me:D, Bye!

Review title: So Good, Amazing Cast and So Much Action
Review_body: This movie is literally amazing. I never expect the Now You See Me movies to be so excellent, but this has taken a place as one of my favorite movies of all time. The cast is unbeatable, the special effects/editing/cinematography are intriguing, and there are plenty of plot twists. I can never figure out the techniques behind the magic tricks so I love how this movie surprises me so much. Definitely go see this movie! And see it in the theaters if possible, because the big screen makes the whole experience so amazing. Also, random, but the soundtrack to this movie is spot-on. It's modern, upbeat, and sexy with a few great Chinese pop songs. Definitely a must-see!

I remember seeing Now You See Me (2013) several times a couple years back while on an international flight. I certainly enjoyed it, but didn't think it to be one of my favorite movies of all time.NYSM2, however, is even more well done and absolutely enrapturing. I saw it twice, and I have to say, the second time was even better than the first. Although visual effects (added in post) are certainly used in the film, the many feats of "magic" are most definitely real. It was wonderful seeing a film with such attention to detail and sleight of hand. A must-see.

Review title: What a Macau citizen thinks about the movie
Review_body: Being a citizen of Macau, I think the appearance of Macau in the movie is a total mess. I don't know whether foreigners think that China is still a place which is stuck in the past century or something. Who would wear silk dresses and watch a b/w television nowadays? Besides I don't think shops in the style of that magic shop would exist and there is no such place called "Taipa Market". In addition I can't understand why the film makers made Macau a place filled with gangsters and "barbarians"... Macau is a friendly city where tourists are given good service.I think most of the movie is acceptable but like the first movie, the ending ruins the whole thing. Even though the effects are quite awesome, the plot of the movie bored me(too many useless scenes). I think what the audience want to see is how great the four horsemen are and the unique way they steal with magic, but not seeing them fail their acts. What I see in movie 2 is four kids throwing cards around while their guardian was watching, therefore I think Movie 1 is way better than the second.

When I stepped in to watch Now You See Me 2, the scenes of the first movie was riveting in my mind.But this film proved to be a HUGE disappointment. It was as if it had caved under the weight of its predecessor. The plot continuously loses grip. One is left questioning "what? I don't get it". Trust me the tricks seem more realistic than the plot. Too many so called twists in the tale. Well its not needed. The movie doesn't remain true to its genre. And characterization. Whoa! Talent seems wasted. Jesse Eisenberg deserved more screen space. Instead Daniel Radcliffe - great actor he may be- cant save a sinking plot. And Woody Harrelson in two roles. Not good. Lizzy Chaplan tries to impress us with her humor.Well it just didn't click. Morgan Freeman excellent as ever. But again not enough screen space. Reserving the best for the last, Mark Ruffalo. He seemed well and truly into the character. He sells his role to us. But the plot collapses. None of the greats in the movie could save it and thats a shame. All i could think when I stepped out was "why oh why take a sequel. Couldn't we just float in the magic of the first part".

Review title: Slide of hand or booed off the stage?
Review_body: The Four Horsemen come back into the light to take on their biggest challenge yet. But are they able to succeed the brilliantly over-complicated Now You See Me or would their second act disappoint, Join Film an TV Nerd to find out.2013's Now You See Me was entertaining nonsense, and the sequel is pretty much the same deal.So the short version of this review is that if you liked the first film then this one will probably work just as well for you. On the other hand it's unlikely to convert and newcomers - but maybe that's not a problem given the box office return the first time around.There's a lot of razzle and dazzle in the film, courtesy of new director Jon M. Chu (Step Up 3D, GI Joe 2), which makes perfect sense for a story about magicians who steal things during spectacular stunts.The set pieces are enjoyable enough, with some over the top card skills a particular highlight. Some vehicular action is a little dull but otherwise this is a handsome production which amps up the silliness to keep things moving at a brisk pace.Script wise it's not bad, but pretty much this is oceans eleven with added magic tricks. Whilst trying to have continuity in the form of agent Rhodes childhood and even an odd appearance by an "Evil Twin" Brother, this continues the story on 18 months after the events of the first film whilst adding a bit of a back story at the same time.In terms of new additions, Lizzy Caplan definitely makes an impression but her motor mouthing mostly annoyed me. She like a yapping puppy who doesn't know when to stop, seeking all the attention even though she doesn't really add that much besides some diversity to the group. Then there's Daniel Radcliffe who is mostly entertaining as villain but looks oddly ill throughout the film.Jesse Eisenberg , Mark Ruffalo , Woody Harrelson , Dave Franco , Michael Caine and Morgan Freeman all return to reprise their respected roles and do a decent job of it.Of course there are various twists through out, but this time around your not really left with that sense of wonder of how did they pull it all off. Saying that this is still a fun film that continues the tale of the modern day robin hoods as they become part of the fabled "eye".The action takes place mainly away from the sates where the horsemen are all wanted by the FBI, as we visit the far east and the landmarks of London. The sets are over-elaborate and well polished as well they should be for this style of film, its just a shame that fight scenes fall victim the shaky cam is shaky curse making it even harder to see the tricks taking place.But overall few fun tricks, some famous faces and a fittingly over the top finale make Now You See Me 2 a very familiar two hours at the cinema. It's a little long and a bit basic but entertaining enough while it lasts So out of a possible five stars Now you see me 2 earns: ✪✪✪ It seems very realistic to What did you think of this film? Feedback is always welcome here on wordpress, click here for the facebook page and finally follow me on Twitter @CongertonLee for the latest reviews.Thank you for reading!

I only recently saw Now You See Me, on DVD, in preparation for this release - and then read some reviews which made me wonder if I should have made the effort. I'm pleased to say that I need not have worried, and I enjoyed this film just as much as the first - and possibly more; some of the illusions were worth the entrance in themselves. I liked seeing more of the characters and some depth develop to them, and unlikely as it might be, I'd certainly be up for watching a third outing. I say this as someone who doesn't necessarily enjoy magic on TV, and the difference here was probably the engaging cast. Dave Franco was a very pleasant surprise - endearing but not too cocky - and Mark Ruffalo manages to take centre stage and be self-effacing all at the same time. Big thumbs up.

Unlike others I was thoroughly entertained and impressed by Now You See Me 2. I am a huge fan of the first movie so I was skeptical of the sequel, but it truly didn't disappoint me. All of the tricks really got me and long after the movie my boyfriend and I still were talking about what we thought about every trick in the movie. Honestly, go watch it for yourself. I don't understand where the bad ratings are coming from. It is surprising, it is exciting, and it is enthralling. it is everything I could have wished for in a second movie for Now You See Me and I am very excited to see what the third one holds. Go see this movie! you will not regret it !

I sat in the cinema watching this movie with a huge smile on my face the whole time. I loved everything about this movie. Plot, darker secrets, the fact that the Horsemen were in hiding and how impatient they were getting. Character development played a HUGE role, and I loved the playfulness and familiarity between them and also the tension and strain between others. And the plot twists!! I won't say anymore ;) The action in this movie was brilliant. Every scene had something in it I loved, whether it was character exploring, action, mind-bending tricks, or just some really amazing magic! Definitely worth seeing. Both movies are amazing but this one is spectacular!

"The more you look, the less you see" This quote in the the movie "Now You See Me", aptly describes it's sequel "Now You See Me-2". Now You See Me-2 is a silly, goofy and fun sequel to a silly, goofy and fun thriller which resolves around the world of magic and illusions. It's that kind of movie where every time your mind is trying to find the secret within the quick-moving story line. The casts, director and screenwriters have tried something weird and funky. One special thing about this movie is that Woody Harrelson gets to play his original character, Merritt McKinney, who is a renowned magician and hypnotist and uses his tricks and powers to pull off some brilliant crimes. Things make sense until the halfway point of the movie before all the trilling but illogical sequence of scene starts unfolding. Anyone watching this movie without having seen the first movie of the series(Now You See Me) would probably be lost more than once. The universe created in this movie is more than comically cartoonish and surreal. Coming to the plot, the person making things difficult for the Horsemen in the movie this time is Walter Mabry(Daniel Radcliffe), a wealthy businessman who once partnered with the target of horsemen in the previous movie. Due to this, the money that horsemen stole sort of belonged to him, and now he is seeking reparations. Mabry's role is of a man with double, triple... dose of devilish ego. Also, one amongst the new cast who are a part of this movie is Lizzy Caplan, who replaces original star Isla Fisher. If you do have have a good memory, then anything which you might remember from the movie after some weeks of watching it is it's benchmark-Gimmick, a cleverly staged "sleight of hand" trick that involves stealing a microchip hidden in a playing card. But still, this movie offers as much entertainment as it is expected to.

Review title: Not as good as the first one but wasn't terrible
Review_body: The tricks in the first one were much better in my opinion and I honestly felt like there were more in the first one as well. In the second one, why did Woody Harrelson have to play a twin? The whole evil twin thing was not needed. Surely there could have been another actor playing a different relative. I didn't like seeing Woody talking with (basically) himself.One thing that really bothered me and made me not like it as much was the fact that James Franco's character was in 2 places at once. Let me explain. So, near the end of the movie, when The Four Horsemen were "setting up" their finale, Jack Wilder was performing the Queen trick (his first location). Then it goes to the evil twin finding and walking with Merritt McKinney. Merritt then calls Dylan Rhodes to warn him and the others that Walter and his father are on to where their next location will be. You don't find out until they start describing how the trick was done that Jack Wilder was also at this brotherly encounter (location 2). Jack was the one who hypnotized the evil twin and told him to throw them out of the plane. After Merritt calls Dylan, then Jack, Lula, and Atlas abandon their tricks. So how was Jack able to perform a trick in one location and then hypnotize someone in another location? I know they were magicians, but even magicians can't really be in two locations at once.

Review title: Now You See Me, and I hope I won't ever again.
Review_body: My father and I loved the first movie, we were completely blown away by the special effects, the ideas for the magic acts, and the plot was gripping. Naturally, we thought the sequel would live up to it's name. Boy were we ever so wrong. 20 minutes in, and I felt that this was not going to be anything interesting. No one is in character. Lula is dull and annoying, we have no idea what happened to Henley apart from the fact that she left and Atlas is bitter about it, Jack well he's just nice to look at in this movie, and two Woody Harrelson's is, well, too damn much. This movie had so much potential, but it seeped through the plot holes. Not only did it lack magic acts like it had in the first one, but at some point I asked myself "What is this about again?" SO MUCH POTENTIAL JUST WENT OUT THE WINDOW ALRIGHT? Acting on point, but you can't do anything if the writers don't deliver. Such disappointment, and I really don't understand how this movie is rated almost 7 stars. Also near the end of the movie, well they just re-used what they had in the first one, and it just made everyone groan. Cheesy, predictable, disappointing, and I hope to never watch this again.

First one was super awesome with the story and the mystery behind it, It was simply an astonishing movie to watch and lot of satisfaction and "wow" at the end. I was personally expecting at least upto that standard but I'm really disappointed the story waste lot of time at the beginning where the new character comes to the picture and some incidents happened in the film does not have connection.I was waiting till the last few minutes to see the big reveal even after the trick was performed I believe there should be something big finish than this, to me this is very poor comparing to the first one. I think actors perform superbly but the script was so bad.

Honestly, I don't understand all the bad reviews. Sure, it's not an Academy Award worthy film, but I assume people know that before they go see it. Just take it for what it is: a fun, entertaining movie about magicians and tricks. Don't expect everything to make sense, because of course, most of it is actually silly but still fun nonetheless. Mark Ruffalo is always a delight to watch and the rest of the cast make a great team as well. Don't expect a super smart plot, just a typical fast paced film that will keep you on your toes. I will say the original goal of the team is mostly forgotten throughout the two hours, but I don't think that matters much. All in all, I would definitely recommend this movie and I think it's a solid 7/10.

Firstly, there are no real spoilers here. I just didn't want to test the limits of IMDb on my first review.I was pleasantly surprised at how good this was! The plot, twists and general magic related bits and visuals in general were unique and, just really cleverly conceived and executed. Impressed at every turn!Although alas, I will never be able to see Daniel Radcliffe as anything other than Harry Potter. I hope it isn't considered a spoiler to tell you... he is not playing Harry Potter in this.Morgan Freeman is a legend, as per usual and plays his role brilliantly. I'm always impressed when an actor that you want to like/hate, plays the opposite role, and makes it believable. Usually sequels are underwhelming. This wasn't!

The original "Now You See Me" was riveting; the sequel is ridiculous. The original did a perfect job of blurring the line between magic as an illusion and magic as supernatural. "2" in a futile attempt to top the original, crosses the line into puerile preposterousness. "2" was in fact so inane that I can't even summon the enthusiasm to write a review panning it. I wasted over two hours watching this...I'm not wasting any more time writing about it.

The heists are bigger, the illusions are flashier, and the pace is quicker in "Now You See Me 2". Even the cast is livelier and more fun. The plot absolutely blew me away and my enthusiasm for this film knew no bounds. Congratulations to the screenwriters Ed Solomon, who did a brilliant job. The twists and turns that finally led to the dramatic finale was absolutely dazzling and unexpected. I think that it's astounding the director's ability to trick us and misdirect us, so you're never entirely sure what has happened until everything is explained. The special effects were absolutely stunning and the use of real life magic sequences fit perfectly. The use of contemporary music mix with popular songs on the film's soundtrack was also well thought out and it took the film to the next level. No wonder the crew received a standing ovation from the audience at the end of the film, even though we were at the cinema.

Review title: Not as good as the 1st but still fun
Review_body: If you liked the 1st film, you'll find this enjoyable but not as good ! I liked the links to the 1st film but, have to admit, there was something not quite the same in this sequel.

OK I could mention the banal plot, the bad casting, and the pretty impressive effects. But....I have a thing about certain actors. Some do little wrong. Tom Hanks and Meryl Streep are the first names that spring to mind.Woody Harrelson has just got one of those faces, and acting methods, that makes me want to punch him, the screen and the casting director. I'm afraid this started as early as Cheers. And in this film we get him twice playing twins.Did anyone else want Michael Caine to kill the horseman pretty early on?

This movie is a complete waste of time. Don't watch it, because you will be disappointed. The story is bad, the characters don't make any sense, and the final annoy you so much. The director should be banned from making other movies. I wanted to die myself throughout the whole of the movie.

I read some (not some,there a lot) very bad reviews about this movie but i can't understand there point.What i get that they were trying to say that there is another level of tricks in this movie and there is no explanation and they can't understand how things are happening.
Really?
Remember,if you can understand magic, then there is nothing like magic.
This is what this movie is about.BTW there is explanations for twists in this movie but who needs explanation for magic.If they tell you how they were performing those tricks,there will nothing remain like magic.
For Example,in action movies like Fast and Furious Series,there is not explanations for those impossible stunts like how a car can fly?Moreover Now you see me seires is all about magic.They are saying that they are showing magic.If people can easily umderstand their tricks,the purpose of movie would collapse.
So these points in these reviews are baseless.
Its like to watch harry potter and ask how they were performing magic.
Its against the definition of magic that you can understand it.
Come to the acting,almost all the cast is experienced and i found no issue with that.But i should say that the speed of the events occuring in the movie is bit high.Pace could be bit slow.Also i found some comments which were saying that this movie was looking all about tricks.
No it was not looking all about tricks it was really all about tricks.
It was a movie based on magical tricks.The difference was they give you story and yeah there is story which is also mgical.
In the end it was entertaining movie!
Note:Before watching this movie,you should make it clear in your mind that you're going to watch magic and after watching agian you shoud recall that you've watched magic!
Then there will be no questions in your mind like how those tricks were performed and you will find this movie entertaining!
The first was muah. This is worse. Budget went out on Harry Potter in stead of a plot.

Review title: SPECTACULAR! (ignore the bad reviews, go see for yourself!)
Review_body: Now You See Me 2 - a perfect sequel to one of my favourite films of all time. Looking for something fast-paced, fun, with amazing actors?This movie has it all.About a year and a half after successfully outsmarting the FBI, the remaining of the Four Horsemen (Jesse Eisenberg, Dave Franco and Woody Harrelson) have concealed themselves from the public of New York City accompanied by a new addition to the team: Lula (Lizzy Caplan).However, during a comeback act, the Four Horsemen somehow manage to wind up in Macau, China, where the greater part of the movie takes place; and where I believe the best scene occurs.My favourite scene, which is famously known as the card scene, happens as the Horsemen carry out their cunning plan after having been instructed to steal a computer chip for a criminal named Walter Mabry (acted exceptionally by Daniel Radcliffe).This action-filled scene is guaranteed to make your heart race, as the Horsemen attempt to sneak the chip out of a Science Centre. Practically-done tricks combined with CGI makes for a spectacular scene. The mise-en-scene captures tension with the soundtrack, acting, and camera shots that follow the card as it's being flicked back and forth between them. Wide-eyes and nervous jokes made by the Horsemen are what add character to the scene. Especially when it feels as if you've stepped into their shoes.Suspense rings throughout this entire movie. The many plot-holes build excitement and interest as well as the appearances of well-known acting stars.

Review title: Should have been called a film slightly inspired by Now You See Me!!
Review_body: One of the best films I have seen in recent years was 'Now You See Me'. Brilliant film, lots of wonder and twists, an excellent movie. This however is a very very poor sequel, where is the magic, the awe, the twists, the things we loved from the first movie? The only thing that stood out was Daniel Washington's performance which was every bit as good as the first movie. But take that 2 minutes out of the movie and the rest was very disappointing.
Not sure why they didn't name this "And now you don't." Huge lost opportunity.
